1�Ha, were you three still alive?Now you can watch as life is breathed into the Chrysalis Core once again!
1�What you see below you is the heart of Delkfutt's Tower. Regenerating it will open the path to Tu'Lia.
1�Just as we Zilart slept for thousands of years, Tu'Lia also remains in slumber. Miles above the surface of Vana'diel, it bides its time until the day of awakening.
1�And when it awakes, eternal paradise will be within our grasp.
1�You are fairly intuitive for a mere Hume.Thirty years ago, when Raogrimm came in contact with the crystal in the cursed Northlands, some of its energy flowed to this tower.
1�It was that burst of power that awoke us, giving us the opportunity to continue our quest for Paradise.
1�Every soul in Vana'diel wants to believe that there's a gate to eternal paradise somewhere on this planet.
1�A pure, untainted world, perfect in every facet. A crystalline paradise fit for the gods.
1�That is the vision...and you vermin are not part of it.
1�Hah-hah-hah! I can no longer fool you.Behold! I am the will of the crystal!
1�And now I shall wield its true power and make this planet mine!Rise forth, Crystal Warriors!4�
1�I will let them take care of you.
1�Ah, we have an uninvited guest...
1�So you have come here to die, have you? Well, I'll give you the honor of being taken down by my blade.
1�This is your end. Perish, fools, in the name of the crystal!4�
1�Wh-why?I am the will...of the crystal... How could I be defeated by mere mortals?
1�Warriors! Why do you just sit there and watch?
1�Eald'narche!? What do you mean? Wh-why are you...
1�The crystal doesn't need...me? It can't be possible... You can't leave me here like this!
1�Yes... You still need me to revive Tu'Lia!
1�No... So, you were planning to use her all along...
1�Why... What did I do to deserve...this...4
1�Isn't Tu'Lia the floating island also known as the Gate of the Gods? I thought it was destroyed when the ancient capital of the Zilart was submerged.
1�Slept? You mean to tell me that you've been sleeping here in Delkfutt's Tower for ten thousand years?
1�Little brother... But then...You're the elder prince of the Zilart?
1�Plan? You mean, to open the Gate of the Gods?
1�Gate of the Gods...
1�You wouldn't dare!
1�I'm going back to Norg. I'll see if my father can give us any help.
1�Long ago, your people paid the price for what you did. What's to be gained by chasing after lost dreams?
1�??Memories of the ancients??? What does this have to do with Raogrimm?
1�It... It cannot be!
1�Wait!
1�Someone has to stop him, or it will mean the end of Vana'diel as we know it.
1�The Chrysalis Core?
1�I've had enough! You've spent the last thirty years deceiving all of us in Jeuno.
1�You could care less about the people of this world! You are just using the power of the gods in an attempt to take over Vana'diel!
1�Who the hell are these characters?4�
1�Verena?Verena! Are you all right!?
1�But even if you did have it, you wouldn't be able to use it on your own!
1�Stop! What are you doing to her!?
1�Verena!
1�Verena! Open your eyes! Verena!
1�Why, you!
1�My poor brother, haven't you realized? The crystal doesn't need you anymore.
1�You were foolish to believe that the crystal ever chose you.
1�Regenerating the Chrysalis Core? You need not worry, my brother. I have found another way to do that.
1�Now let the show begin...
1�Of course she's all right, you imbecile. Why would I harm my key to the Chrysalis Core?
1�A lucky find, this girl was. Who would have thought this simple Hume would have such extraordinary resonating ability?
1�Farewell, my little brother. Return to the crystal from which you were born.
1�You shouldn't be deceived by appearances. My growth was stopped the moment I came in contact with the crystal, ten thousand years ago.
1�And ten thousand years I have waited to put my plan into motion.

1�What else?To open the gate, the regeneration of the Chrysalis Core was necessary. However, the unexpected arrival of that Raogrimm character interfered with the crystals' power. His existence created too much ??noise.??
1�Luckily for me, you people succeeded in defeating the Shadow Lord, causing the noise to disappear. My plan took a turn when I realized that Raogrimm was a Talekeeper.
1�I could utilize the long lost ??memories of the ancients?? he carried to regenerate the Chrysalis Core.
1�I would not think that you would know of such matters. I assume that not even Raogrimm himself knew. What he carried was not in his mind, but in his blood.
1�If I were to obtain a part of him, I could use it instead of having to rely on my useless brother.
1�Yes, you are right. That is where your sister Verena comes in.
1�The soul of your younger sister resonates with the souls of the beastmen. Only she can communicate with them.
1�Now, Verena. Let us begin.
1�Behold, the Gate of the Gods--Tu'Lia!
1�I have no more use for her. If you want her that much, you can have her back.
1�Don't you, too, want to pass through the Gate of the Gods? Don't you, too, want to know what awaits in eternal paradise? Come to Tu'Lia, and see with your own eyes.
1�Only after you enter Paradise will you mortals know true happiness.
1�The questions to which you have no answers--you will find those answers in Tu'Lia.
1�And once you have come to realize that your existence is meaningless, I will change the world into a crystal, set to shine for eternity...
1�I wouldn't? Why don't you come to Tu'Lia and find out?
1�However, only those who have been blessed by the light and whose power has been accepted by the crystal can pass through the gate.
1�Travel to Ro'Maeve and prove yourselves.I will be waiting for you on the other side.
1�Heh-heh-heh...Ah-hah-hah-hah!4�
1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Return to Delkfutt's Tower(pt.1).Return to Delkfutt's Tower(pt.2).Return to Delkfutt's Tower(pt.3).Mercenary Camp(pt.1).Mercenary Camp(pt.2).Ode of Life Bestowing(pt.1).Ode of Life Bestowing(pt.2).Ode of Life Bestowing(pt.3).Ode of Life Bestowing(pt.4).
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Now, listen close...
1�Press a button to continue.
1�Press a button to continue.
1�Greetings, and welcome to the Serpent Camp for Mercenaries.I'll be your head instructor, Counselor Rughadjee
n.�Hm? What's with the shocked silence?You know what you're here for, don't yo
d!�They won't be around for long anyway.Not against the five of u
g.�Bah, you're too soft on 'em.You won't have that luxury on the battlefiel
u?�Well, of course they don't!No one ever takes the time to explain anything, they just issue orders!I'm Counselor Najelith, and I'll be assisting with your combat trainin
o!�      Innocent blood spills forth onto the plains of Vana'diel.
1�      The world shudders as she is thrust into chaos and despair.
1�      Neither power nor destiny...
1�      ...can bring an end to what has already begun.
1�      But as one bright star shines through the clouds at night...     And as one song rings clear above the roar of beasts...
1�      We hold to one hope in these darkest of times.
1�      That star is you, and the song is yours.
1�      And someday, that hope will become our dreams...
1�      Our prayers...
1�      Shine forth, star of hope!
1�      Let your song ring out across all of Vana'diel!
1�      By the strength of our hopes and our prayers...
1�      What was split asunder...
1�      ...Will once more become whole.
1�      Complete and inseparable for all eternity.
..�Aldo...!?It really...it really is you, Aldo!
1�Aldo... This is--
1�Could it truly be you, Aldo?My brother...
1�Aldo, can you hear me?Please... Open your eyes...
1�Aldo... But this is only a dream, isn't it?
1�A fleeting illusion that will vanish without a trace before I wake to the light of a new day.
1�I will carry on with my other life, with no memory of who I once was...With no memory of you, nor what you mean to me...
1�Why must this be, Aldo?I don't want to leave you again...
4�Emeline!
1�Emeline! Please...
1�The war ended years ago...There's nothing for you to fear anymore.
1�Open your eyes, Emeline!Free yourself from the nightmares of the past!
1�Wh-who... What are you!?
1�The will...of the crystal!?
1�Giver of life? Hah!
1�Don't make me laugh!You're nothing but a twisted shadow!
1�A perverse echo born of my sister's nightmare...A nightmare whose time has long since passed.
1�Emeline...
1�Nor do I, Emeline.And yet, even if we never meet again as brother and sister...
1�Just the knowledge that you still live, under the same sun and stars in this world of Vana'diel...
1�Somehow, that's enough.
h!�I'm afraid there's only room for one Aldo here.
1�This is where we say farewell...dear uncle.
..�So you are the ones who would seek to reverse irreversible fate.To undo that which cannot be undone...
1�You are the ones who would forsake the very love that begot you...and for what?
1�For your pathetic material attachment to a world that was never yours to claim.

1�What sad, piteous creatures you are.You...like this child...cling feebly to your transitory dreams, never realizing that you are but pawns in a game played by powers far beyond your comprehension.
1�But it matters little.
1�Just as a few grains of sand cannot stand against the roaring tide, nor blades of grass against the gusting winds...A smattering of voices cannot drown out the echo of a thousand ages.
1�The prophecy will be fulfilled; the light of this world, extinguished.Your role in this story has come to an end.
1�Come, my children.
..�Embrace your return to the void that birthed yo
u.�Fools!You truly believe you can escape your destiny!?
1�This is the will of the crystal!That which gives life, may take it away.
1�Now look upon the destruction of your beloved Vana'diel!
1�Silence!
1�You know naught of which you speak.The destiny which you would deny was prophesied long before your world came to be.
1�The door to Paradise shall open...
1�And Vana'diel shall return to the darkness from which it was born.
1�The tides of fate will not be turned by the likes of you.
n!�They cannot be extinguished by the likes of--
1�But how...?This...is the power of the antiphon?
1�This is the lifeforce...of Altana's children...?
..�      And so it was that this chapter of     the legend drew to a close...
1�      Consigned once more to the darkness,     the ancient ode would fade slowly from     from the realm of mortals, until it was     naught but a forgotten dream.
1�      But even now, in a far corner of the world...     Another, yet untold chapter of the legend...
1�      Another verse of the ancient song is being woven...
1�      By a child of the past--     one who has not abandoned her dream...
1�      But as one bright star shines through the clouds at night...
1�      And as one song rings clear above the roar of beasts...
1�      A vast ocean of glittering crystals illuminates     the midnight sky, a cosmic wind carrying their     light through time and space.
1�      Shine forth, star of hope!     Let your song ring out across all of Vana'diel!
1�And then one day,in a time to come...

1�Casting and removing moogle magic on adventurers like yourself is my specialty, kupo.What's the magic for, you ask? You could say it's a ticket for entry into battlefields from which abundant honor can be won!
